assigned_cwe_name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
cwe_description: The product constructs all or part of an OS command using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that can modify the intended OS command when it is sent to a downstream component for execution.
explanation: The code is vulnerable to OS command injection (CWE-78) as it uses an attacker-controlled environment variable (EDITOR/VISUAL) to construct and execute a command via system(), allowing arbitrary command execution. Furthermore, it creates a temporary file with a predictable name in /tmp, leading to a Time-of-Check to Time-of-Use (TOCTOU) race condition (CWE-367) that could result in arbitrary file overwrite or information disclosure.

Furthermore, it creates a temporary file with a predictable name in /tmp, leading to a Time-of-Check to Time-of-Use (TOCTOU) race condition (CWE-367) that could result in arbitrary file overwrite or information disclosure.

assigned_cwe_name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
cwe_description: The software constructs all or part of an OS command using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended OS command when it is sent to a downstream component for execution.
explanation: The code retrieves the 'EDITOR' or 'VISUAL' environment variable, which is user-controlled. If this variable contains a space, the program constructs a command string using sprintf and executes it via system(). This allows an attacker to inject arbitrary shell commands by setting a malicious value for the environment variable, leading to arbitrary code execution.
